messages.title: Fair is worth fighting for
messages.content: Rebecca Lawson is your Green Party parliamentary candidate for Wavertree. Rebecca has lived in Liverpool for over ten years and lectures in Psychology at Liverpool University. Rebecca is extremely concerned about tackling the effects of climate change.

messages.title: Care is the message of the Green Party: it shapes our policies.
messages.content: We care for the planet. And we care for those things that make our living on the planet possible, from bees and trees, to people, to a stable economy. Caring is often a joyful experience. For most of us, caring for our children, families, homes, friends and neighbours is what is most important to us, it gives us joy and deep satisfaction.

messages.title: The national Green Party manifesto demands that carers be properly rewarded for the work they do.
messages.content: A more generous Carer's Allowance, increased by 50% to £80 a week. Providing more short breaks to families, including disabled people or those with long-term illnesses. Such schemes save money by preventing crises.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Green Party wants carbon emissions to be cut by 10% per year - starting right now.
Over £1billion of public money is wasted on NHS privatisation yet care suffers. Greens demand locally accessible, quality services for all.
We would increase pensions from £98 to £170 per week and provide free home insulation to all pensioners.
Our Green New Deal would create an extra million jobs and training places.
We want to introduce 20mile speed limits in all residential areas.

The Green Party promotes refurbishment of housing over demolition. There are about one million empty homes in Britain - and too many of them are here in Wavertree. Our manifesto pledges to reduce this number through empty property use orders. Also any regeneration schemes should work with, not against, existing living communities so that the mistakes of the past are not repeated.
Giving carers cheaper local travel on buses and trains.

issues.health: Over £1billion of public money is wasted on NHS privatisation yet care suffers. Greens demand locally accessible, quality services for all.

housing.content: The Green Party promotes refurbishment of housing over demolition. There are about one million empty homes in Britain - and too many of them are here in Wavertree. Our manifesto pledges to reduce this number through empty property use orders. Also any regeneration schemes should work with, not against, existing living communities so that the mistakes of the past are not repeated.

leaflet.personalStatement: Rebecca is extremely concerned about tackling the effects of climate change.

endorsements.endorsement: Vote for what you believe in. There are no real differences between the main three parties. If you really want change, vote Green

quotes.text: Vote for what you believe in. There are no real differences between the main three parties. If you really want change, vote Green
quotes.source: Alistair McGowan in the Independent, 25 April

images.caption: Rebecca Lawson's image as your Wavertree MP candidate for Green Party.
